5.title: STRADVISION to showcase groundbreaking ADAS innovations at CES 2025 featuring Texas instruments technology
5.snippet: STRADVISION to showcase groundbreaking ADAS innovations at CES 2025 featuring Texas instruments technology ... STRADVISION, a leader in deep learning-based vision...
5.content:
Press Release, 6 January 2025

STRADVISION, a leader in deep learning-based vision perception technology is set to showcase their latest innovations featuring Texas Instruments (TI) processors at CES 2025. The collaboration highlights the integration of TI’s TDA4VPE-Q1 system-on-a-chip (SoC) for L2 domain controllers and STRADVISION’s SVNet 3D Perception Network, a production-ready, deep learning-powered solution that redefines ADAS and autonomous driving capabilities.

A Fusion of Cutting-Edge Technologies: SVNet 3D Perception Network based on the TDA4VPE-Q1 SoC

The TI TDA4VPE-Q1 automotive SoC, designed for multi-camera ADAS applications, integrates advanced sensor fusion, edge AI, graphics, and video co-processing. With 16 TOPS of AI performance, 4x Arm® Cortex®-A72 cores, optimized memory architecture, and a heterogeneous design, it delivers unparalleled efficiency while lowering system costs. This platform supports diverse imaging solutions, including Level 2 and Level 2+ ADAS, auto valet parking, 3D surround view, and more making it a versatile and cost-effective choice for next-generation automotive applications.

Paired with the TI TDA4VPE-Q1 SoC, the SVNet 3D Perception Network solution converts 2D camera data into precise 3D environmental maps, enabling vehicles to perceive their surroundings with exceptional clarity. Designed for adaptability, the SVNet platform supports high-level autonomous driving across various Operational Design Domains (ODD), including complex and challenging conditions.

Showcasing Innovation at CES 2025

At CES 2025, attendees can witness a live demonstration of the SVNet based on TDA4VPE-Q1 automotive SoC. The demo highlights its capabilities in enabling multi-camera inputs for advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS), such as Level 2+ highway driving, auto valet parking, 3D surround view, and memory-based automatic parking.

A Game-Changer for Automotive Applications

STRADVISION’s SVNet, integrated with the TDA4V-Mid Plus Eco SoC, empowers automotive OEMs to deliver scalable ADAS solutions. The SoC’s flexibility accommodates various image sensors and resolutions, supporting ADAS domain controllers, front cameras, surround views, and mirror replacement. This collaboration paves the way for innovation in automotive, robotics, and security systems.

“We are proud to collaborate with Texas Instruments to bring cost-effective yet powerful solutions to the automotive industry,” said Philip Vidal, CBO of STRADVISION. “The TDA4VPE-Q1 automotive SoC, paired with STRADVISION’s SVNet, exemplifies our shared vision for advancing ADAS technologies. With production-ready software development concluding in 2025 and a Start of Production (SoP) targeted for 2026, we are poised to meet the demands of an evolving market. This collaboration also underscores our commitment to global expansion, enabling us to address the rising demand for innovative and scalable solutions worldwide.”

“The TDA4VPE-Q1 automotive system-on-a-chip for L2 domain controllers with graphics, AI, and video co-processing embodies our vision of delivering high-performance, flexible, and efficient solutions for next-generation automotive applications,” said Mike Pienovi, product line manager at Texas Instruments. “Our collaboration with STRADVISION and their SVNet software demonstrates how technology can accelerate the move from 2D to 3D perception networks.”

About STRADVISION

Founded in 2014, STRADVISION is an automotive industry pioneer in artificial intelligence-based vision perception technology for ADAS. The company is accelerating the advent of fully autonomous vehicles by making ADAS features available at a fraction of the market cost compared with competitors. STRADVISION’s SVNet is being deployed on various vehicle models in partnership with OEMs; can power ADAS and autonomous vehicles worldwide; and is serviced by over 300 employees in Seoul, San Jose, Detroit, Tokyo, Shanghai, and Dusseldorf. STRADVISION has been honored with Frost & Sullivan’s 2022 Global Technology Innovation Leadership Award, the Gold Award at the 2022 and 2021 AutoSens Awards for Best-in-Class Software for Perception Systems, and the 2020 Autonomous Vehicle Technology ACES Award in Autonomy (software category). In addition, STRADVISION and its software have achieved TISAX’s AL3 standard for information security management, as well as being certified to the ISO 9001:2015 for Quality Management Systems and ISO 26262 for Automotive Functional Safety.

7.title: @CES2025 Automotive Round-Up 2Day: HARMAN, Schaeffler, Texas Instruments, Arbe Robotics, NVIDIA, Garmin, Qualcomm, Trimble, STRADVISION, Pebble, AiDEN Automotive, HERE, Smart Eye, VicOne, P3, SMK, AiDEN, Aeva & Wideye | auto connected
7.snippet: Today there announcements from HARMAN, Schaeffler, Texas Instruments, Arbe Robotics, NVIDIA, Garmin, Qualcomm, Trimble, STRADVISION, Pebble, AiDEN Automotive,...
7.content:
Today was eventful at CES 2025. On Sunday there were a few announcements and AUTO Connected Car News rounded-up dozens of CES 2025 releases prior to the show. Tonight Sony and Honda revealed the AFEELA electric sedan that feels people. Today there announcements from

HARMAN, Schaeffler, Texas Instruments, Arbe Robotics, NVIDIA, Garmin, Qualcomm, Trimble, STRADVISION, Pebble, AiDEN Automotive, HERE, Smart Eye, VicOne, P3, SMK, AiDEN, Aeva and Wideye.

Tonight Jensen Huang will give a keynote which we will report on tomorrow.

HARMAN Drives Innovation Through Collaboration at CES 2025

LAS VEGAS–At CES 2025, HARMAN, a subsidiary of Samsung Electronics, announced new partnerships with leading tech and automotive companies to transform the industry with empathetic, intelligent in-cabin experiences.

HARMAN’s collaborations include integrating Cerence AI into its Ready Engage system, launching the “Luna” avatar to offer personalized, emotionally intelligent interactions. This system enhances user engagement with voice and visual capabilities while ensuring data security through Ready Link Marketplace’s integration of Cerence AI’s on-device small language model.

In partnership with HL Klemove, HARMAN combines advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS) with cockpit technologies. Together, they developed a light central compute unit (CCU) and are progressing toward a product-grade platform to streamline automakers’ timelines and customization options.

Leveraging Samsung’s expertise, HARMAN’s Ready Display products bring theater-quality visuals to vehicles using Neo QLED technology. This co-development includes the industry’s first HDR10+-compliant in-car display, showcasing innovative design and functionality.

Collaborations with Miovision and Qualcomm Technologies enhance safety and connectivity. HARMAN Ready Aware uses vehicle-to-network solutions to provide drivers with real-time traffic and hazard alerts, while Ready Connect integrates 5G and satellite communication for seamless connectivity.

Through its partnership with Gentherm, HARMAN Ready Care integrates real-time monitoring of driver stress and focus with personalized interventions, such as seat-based heating and cooling, for enhanced safety and comfort.

“At HARMAN, we believe collaboration is key to unlocking the full potential of automotive innovation,” said Christian Sobottka, President of HARMAN Automotive. “These partnerships embody our mission to deliver cutting-edge, intuitive in-cabin experiences that meet the evolving needs of consumers and automakers alike.”

HARMAN’s CES 2025 showcase highlights how collective intelligence is shaping the future of intelligent, empathetic vehicles.

HARMAN Unveils Contextually Intelligent In-Car Tech at CES 2025

At CES 2025, HARMAN, a subsidiary of Samsung Electronics, introduced its latest suite of in-cabin innovations designed to make cars smarter and more empathetic. Featuring groundbreaking technologies like the Ready Engage AI system with the “Luna” avatar, Ready Care driver monitoring, and Ready Connect for seamless connectivity, HARMAN’s portfolio enhances safety, comfort, and personalization. These advancements, supported by cutting-edge hardware like Ready Upgrade and central compute units, showcase HARMAN’s commitment to transforming vehicles into adaptive, context-aware environments that redefine the driving experience.

Schaeffler Showcases Motion Innovation at CES 2025

Schaeffler, a global leader in motion technology, will unveil its expanded portfolio and expertise at CES 2025 in the West Hall of the Las Vegas Convention Center (Booth 4140) from January 7-10. Following its merger with Vitesco Technologies, Schaeffler now offers a comprehensive range of solutions across power transmission, energy generation, sustainability, and electromobility.

Key exhibits include:

Humanoid Technology Exhibit: Demonstrates Schaeffler’s advancements in robotics and movement control.

Demonstrates Schaeffler’s advancements in robotics and movement control. Dynamic Performance Vehicle: Showcases electrified powertrain and chassis system innovations.

Showcases electrified powertrain and chassis system innovations. Motion Hub: Highlights the integration of eight motion technology product families.

Highlights the integration of eight motion technology product families. Battery Technology: Features advancements in solid-state battery (ASSB) development.

Features advancements in solid-state battery (ASSB) development. Production Technology: Includes AI-powered automation, with EMMA, a mobile cobot, as a centerpiece.

Schaeffler’s innovations emphasize sustainability and efficiency, aligning with its goal of carbon neutrality by 2040. The company invites visitors to explore how it is shaping the future of mobility and motion technology.

Texas Instruments Introduces AI-Enabled Automotive Chips at CES 2025

Texas Instruments (TI) unveiled innovative automotive chips at CES 2025, designed to enhance safety and audio experiences across all vehicle types. Key technologies include:

AWRL6844 60GHz mmWave Radar Sensor A single chip for occupancy monitoring, child presence detection, and intrusion detection, meeting 2025 Euro NCAP standards.

Integrates edge AI algorithms for improved detection accuracy and reduced costs, enabling safer driving environments. AM275x-Q1 and AM62D-Q1 Audio SoCs Next-gen processors featuring TI’s C7x DSP core for premium in-cabin audio.

Capabilities include spatial audio, noise cancellation, and Dolby Atmos integration, with scalable designs to suit various vehicle tiers. TAS6754-Q1 Audio Amplifier Advanced 1L modulation technology reduces power consumption and design complexity while delivering top-tier audio performance.

At CES, TI is showcasing these technologies and more, highlighting innovations in automation, intelligence, and power efficiency for automotive and other applications. Visit TI in the Las Vegas Convention Center North Hall, Room N116, from January 7-10, 2025.

Arbe Robotics and NVIDIA Collaborate to Advance Automotive Perception at CES 2025

Arbe Robotics Ltd., a leader in Perception Radar solutions, is revolutionizing automotive safety and autonomy through its collaboration with NVIDIA. At CES 2025 (Booth 7406, West Hall), Arbe will showcase its ultra-high-definition radar technology, which integrates advanced AI and NVIDIA’s in-vehicle computing platform to redefine vehicle perception and decision-making.

Key innovations include:

AI-Driven Free Space Mapping: Arbe’s radar provides precise mapping of drivable areas, detecting small obstacles and non-reflective targets in all weather conditions.

Integration with NVIDIA DRIVE AGX enables advanced hands-free driving and real-time safety applications. High-Resolution Perception Radar: Supports tens of thousands of detections per frame with a 48×48 MIMO array for exceptional azimuth and elevation resolution.

Enhances ADAS and autonomy by tracking, classifying objects, and eliminating multipath reflection. Seamless Sensor Integration: Provides high-quality data for combining radar with cameras and other sensors in a “Grand Unified Perception Model.”

Visit Arbe’s booth to experience live demonstrations of its cutting-edge radar technology and its transformative impact on autonomous driving.

Garmin Unveils Unified Cabin™ 2025 at CES with AI-Powered Personalization and Advanced Features

Garmin has introduced its latest automotive infotainment solution, Unified Cabin™ 2025, at CES 2025. Honored with a CES Innovation Award, the system offers a comprehensive digital cockpit experience with six displays across four zones, powered by a single control module.

Key features include:

Generative AI Personalization: AI-driven theming for immersive, branded Human Machine Interface (HMI) customization.

Personalized Voice Assistant for each seat, trained to operate vehicle functions. Child Presence Detection (CPD): Ultra-Wide Band technology identifies and classifies seat occupants, improving safety by detecting sleeping children. Dynamic Entertainment and Connectivity: Zoned audio and video deliver unique media streams to individual seats via headrest speakers or Bluetooth.

New app-enabled smartphone control for displays and enhanced device AutoLink using UWB technology. Enhanced Situational Awareness: Augmented reality and computer vision provide detailed views of blind spots on an ultra-wide display. Integrated Display Innovation: Six upgraded displays, including a new ultra-wide front screen, with Corning® Gorilla® Glass for durability and clarity.

Garmin Unified Cabin is a scalable, cost-effective solution built on the Android Automotive Operating System, designed for seamless integration and enhanced user experiences. Visit Garmin at CES 2025 in LVCC West Hall, Booth 3540, to explore this cutting-edge system.

Garmin and Qualcomm Elevate In-Vehicle Experiences with Unified Cabin™ 2025 Collaboration

Garmin and Qualcomm Technologies have expanded their partnership to introduce the next-generation Garmin Unified Cabin™ 2025, unveiled at CES 2025. This innovative digital cockpit solution leverages Qualcomm’s Snapdragon® Cockpit Elite platform, delivering unparalleled entertainment, personalization, and software-defined vehicle architecture capabilities.

Key Highlights:

Advanced AI Integration: Powered by Snapdragon Cockpit Elite’s Neural Processing Unit (NPU), the system supports generative AI for theme customization, voice assistants, and personalized user experiences.

Powered by Snapdragon Cockpit Elite’s Neural Processing Unit (NPU), the system supports generative AI for theme customization, voice assistants, and personalized user experiences. High-Performance Hardware: Features Qualcomm’s Oryon™ CPU, Adreno™ GPU, and Hexagon™ NPU for superior AI-driven multimodal performance across vehicle displays.

Features Qualcomm’s Oryon™ CPU, Adreno™ GPU, and Hexagon™ NPU for superior AI-driven multimodal performance across vehicle displays. Scalable Domain Controller: Garmin’s single control module facilitates a seamless, multi-zone, multi-user experience for infotainment, digital clusters, and entertainment.

This collaboration builds on a successful history, including the award-winning Garmin Unified Cabin domain controller. Garmin and Qualcomm continue to set new standards for in-vehicle experiences, combining innovative hardware and software solutions tailored for automakers.

The Garmin Unified Cabin™ 2025 with Snapdragon Cockpit Elite is on display at CES 2025 by invitation at LVCC West Hall, Booth 3540.

Trimble and Qualcomm Partner to Deliver Precision Positioning for Automated Vehicles

Trimble (Nasdaq: TRMB) and Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. have expanded their collaboration to integrate Trimble ProPointⓇ Go™ positioning engine with Qualcomm’s SnapdragonⓇ Auto 5G Modem-RF Gen 2. This partnership aims to provide precise positioning solutions with 10-centimeter accuracy for automated vehicles, including cars and heavy trucks, with deployment anticipated by 2028.

Key Highlights:

Advanced Positioning Technology: Trimble ProPoint Go combines multi-frequency GNSS signals and Trimble RTXⓇ correction data to deliver centimeter-level positioning accuracy for autonomous and ADAS applications.

Trimble ProPoint Go combines multi-frequency GNSS signals and Trimble RTXⓇ correction data to deliver centimeter-level positioning accuracy for autonomous and ADAS applications. Support for Higher Autonomy Levels: The integration supports Level 2+ ADAS and extends capabilities for Level 3 autonomous driving and C-V2X solutions.

The integration supports Level 2+ ADAS and extends capabilities for Level 3 autonomous driving and C-V2X solutions. Qualcomm’s Snapdragon Platform: The Snapdragon Auto 5G Modem-RF Gen 2 provides high-precision GNSS, C-V2X communications, and advanced RF functionalities, ensuring global compatibility and robust connectivity.

The Snapdragon Auto 5G Modem-RF Gen 2 provides high-precision GNSS, C-V2X communications, and advanced RF functionalities, ensuring global compatibility and robust connectivity. Safety and Reliability: The solution emphasizes safety with ASIL-C certification, enhancing automated driving systems’ confidence and performance.

This collaboration advances the development of autonomous vehicles and heavy trucking, aligning with the industry’s push for greater automation and safety in mobility. Visit Trimble or Qualcomm’s websites for further details.

Primax Group and Tymphany Showcase Groundbreaking Automotive Innovations at CES 2025

Primax Group, encompassing Primax Electronics and Tymphany, will unveil cutting-edge automotive technology solutions at CES 2025 under the Audio Foundry initiative. Highlights include the revolutionary X-IN-1 Sensory Fusion technology, which integrates advanced vision, audio, and interface systems, setting a new benchmark in automotive innovation.

Primax Electronics redefines imaging systems with high-resolution cameras designed for ADAS, CMS, and DMS applications, while introducing Qi wireless charging advancements. Tymphany complements this with premium audio expertise, pioneering solutions like portable audio systems and immersive soundscapes for entertainment and safety.

Leaders from both companies emphasize the synergy between vision and audio technologies, showcasing innovations that merge safety and user experience. Partnerships with Tier-1 suppliers and global brands aim to accelerate adoption, positioning the Primax Tymphany Group as an industry trailblazer in integrated automotive solutions.

Danlaw Unveils CleverCharge: A Smart Home EV Charger Revolutionizing Electric Vehicle Management

Danlaw, Inc., a global leader in connected car technology, has introduced the CleverCharge Level 2 EV charging system at CES 2025, earning an Innovation Award in the Smart Home category. Designed for households with multiple EVs, CleverCharge offers cutting-edge features powered by the CleverKey, a patent-pending OBD-II plug-in device that delivers deep EV intelligence.

Key highlights include:

AI-Driven Assistance: Proactive charging reminders and optimization based on driving routines.

Proactive charging reminders and optimization based on driving routines. Smart Scheduling: Notifications for low energy rates and app-based charging management.

Notifications for low energy rates and app-based charging management. Comprehensive Insights: Real-time data on range, charge time, and battery health.

Real-time data on range, charge time, and battery health. Multi-Vehicle Management: Individual profiles for each EV, automatic recognition, and seamless coordination across multiple charging locations.

Available in Spring 2025, CleverCharge supports various installation options, delivers fast charging speeds (up to 46 mph), and is compatible with all EV models, including Tesla. It will be showcased at CES 2025 in Las Vegas, North Hall Booth #8305. Visit www.clevercharge.com for details.

STRADVISION Unveils Production-Ready SVNet 3D Perception Network at CES 2025

STRADVISION, a leader in AI-based vision technology, will debut the production-ready version of its SVNet 3D Perception Network at CES 2025. Initially introduced as a prototype in 2024, this advanced deep learning solution transforms 2D camera data into precise 3D environmental maps, enabling vehicles to “see” with unparalleled accuracy.

Key Highlights:

Enhanced Features: Incorporates SurroundVision for Level 2+ autonomous driving, adaptability across varied environments, and new autonomous parking capabilities.

Incorporates SurroundVision for Level 2+ autonomous driving, adaptability across varied environments, and new autonomous parking capabilities. Production Timeline: Software development to conclude in 2025, with mass production slated for 2026.

Software development to conclude in 2025, with mass production slated for 2026. Global Expansion: Plans to extend manufacturing into new regions to meet global demand.

The SVNet 3D Perception Network will be demonstrated exclusively for industry professionals at CES 2025, showcasing its MultiVision capabilities and readiness for real-world deployment. CEO Junhwan Kim emphasized the innovation’s transformative impact on the global automotive industry.

Pebble Unveils Production-Intent Design for Pebble Flow All-Electric Travel Trailer

California-based startup Pebble has revealed the production-intent design of its flagship all-electric travel trailer, the Pebble Flow, at CES 2025. The trailer combines cutting-edge technology with user-centric design, aiming to redefine the RV experience for seasoned travelers and newcomers alike.

The Pebble Flow boasts a 45 kWh lithium iron phosphate battery and a 1.1 kW solar array for up to seven days of off-grid adventures. Its advanced automation features, including Magic Hitch for effortless towing and InstaCamp for quick setup, streamline the RVing experience. The trailer also incorporates Active Tow Assist to reduce strain on tow vehicles, a remote control function via the Pebble App for precise parking, and onboard AI powered by NVIDIA DRIVE Orin for seamless operation and over-the-air updates.

Inside, the Pebble Flow offers a flexible and modern design, featuring a queen-sized Murphy bed, a convertible dinette, a chef’s kitchen, and ample natural light from its skylight and large windows. Exterior refinements include improved aerodynamics, integrated tail lamps, and optional all-terrain levelers.

Priced at $109,500, with an upgraded Magic Pack option for $135,500, production begins in early 2025. The first deliveries, including the exclusive Founders Edition, are expected in spring 2025. Customers can reserve their Pebble Flow with a $500 refundable deposit at pebblelife.com/preorder.

AiDEN Automotive and HERE Technologies Partner to Revolutionize Privacy-First Connected Vehicle Experiences

AiDEN Automotive has announced a partnership with HERE Technologies to deliver advanced, privacy-focused in-vehicle services. The collaboration integrates HERE’s automotive-grade location technology into AiDEN’s platform, ensuring drivers benefit from real-time, context-aware navigation and alerts while maintaining control over their data.

Key features include:

Intelligent Alerts : Drivers receive timely notifications based on weight, speed, and road conditions, enhancing safety and efficiency without unnecessary distractions.

: Drivers receive timely notifications based on weight, speed, and road conditions, enhancing safety and efficiency without unnecessary distractions. Enhanced Navigation : Optimized routes, real-time traffic updates, and hazard alerts powered by HERE’s leading location platform.

: Optimized routes, real-time traffic updates, and hazard alerts powered by HERE’s leading location platform. Privacy-Centric Design : Adherence to stringent privacy regulations ensures data is collected minimally and securely.

: Adherence to stringent privacy regulations ensures data is collected minimally and securely. Seamless Integration: Compatible with multiple vehicle models without additional hardware.

The partnership reflects the growing demand for connected vehicle services that prioritize both innovation and user trust. Live demonstrations will be showcased at HERE Technologies Booth (#3500, West Hall) during CES 2025, January 7-10.

Smart Eye Showcases Advanced AI Solutions for In-Cabin Safety and Intelligence

Smart Eye, a leader in Human Insight AI, returns to CES 2025 with an impressive lineup of AI-driven solutions focused on enhancing in-cabin safety, personalization, and vehicle intelligence. Visitors can explore the company’s innovations at Booth #3840 in the West Hall, January 7-10.

Key highlights include:

Driver Monitoring System (DMS) : Featured in the Nissan Ariya, this system detects driver distraction and drowsiness, setting new standards for road safety.

: Featured in the Nissan Ariya, this system detects driver distraction and drowsiness, setting new standards for road safety. Sheila, the Empathetic AI Co-Driver : A CES 2025 Innovation Awards Honoree, Sheila integrates generative AI and advanced sensing for emotionally intelligent, real-time interactions.

: A CES 2025 Innovation Awards Honoree, Sheila integrates generative AI and advanced sensing for emotionally intelligent, real-time interactions. 3D Depth Sensing : Enables adaptive restraint systems for enhanced occupant safety and compliance with global standards.

: Enables adaptive restraint systems for enhanced occupant safety and compliance with global standards. Digital Mirrors: Provide dynamic, intelligent blind-spot monitoring.

Smart Eye will also demonstrate its proven technologies, including AIS DMS, Concept Development Kits, Synthetic Data Generation Tools, and Interior Sensing AI, along with partner showcases featuring Green Hills Software, STMicroelectronics, and Sonatus.

Smart Eye’s booth illustrates the automotive lifecycle, from early development to road-ready systems, highlighting innovations poised to shape the future of mobility. For more information or to schedule a meeting, visit Smart Eye at CES 2025.

Smart Eye Launches AIS+ with Enhanced Safety Features for Fleets and OEMs

Smart Eye, the leading developer of Driver Monitoring Systems (DMS), has unveiled AIS+, the latest iteration of its safety system designed for small-volume OEMs and fleet applications. AIS+ introduces two key features: real-time vibration alerts and optional secure video recording, enhancing its capability to prevent accidents and improve safety.

Key Features of AIS+:

Haptic Alerts : A new vibration alert system integrated into vehicle seats helps refocus drivers’ attention without disturbing passengers, ideal for commercial vehicles.

: A new vibration alert system integrated into vehicle seats helps refocus drivers’ attention without disturbing passengers, ideal for commercial vehicles. Optional Video Recording: Stores up to 100 hours of footage on an SD card, providing valuable insights into driver behavior and system performance while offering customizable privacy controls.

AIS+ builds on Smart Eye’s AI technology to detect and address driver drowsiness and distraction, offering a versatile solution for fleets and manufacturers. Seamlessly integrating with fleet management systems like Geotab, AIS+ reinforces Smart Eye’s commitment to advancing road safety.

For more details, explore AIS+ at CES 2025.

VicOne and P3 Unveil AI Guardian-Enhanced SPARQ AI Voice Assistant



VicOne, a leader in automotive cybersecurity solutions, will demonstrate its AI Guardian solution integrated with P3 digital services’ SPARQ AI Voice Personal Assistant at CES 2025. Hosted at P3’s booth (LVCC, West Hall – 4266), the showcase highlights how VicOne’s AI Guardian protects AI-driven in-vehicle applications from cybersecurity threats like data leaks, AI prompt injections, and unsecure third-party plug-ins.

Key Features of the Combined Solution:

Enhanced Security : AI Guardian shields SPARQ AI Voice Personal Assistant from cyberattacks and privacy breaches, ensuring secure operation of hands-free controls and personalized assistance.

: AI Guardian shields SPARQ AI Voice Personal Assistant from cyberattacks and privacy breaches, ensuring secure operation of hands-free controls and personalized assistance. Smart Cockpit Protection : Integrates with Android Automotive-based systems, providing scalable and secure in-vehicle experiences.

: Integrates with Android Automotive-based systems, providing scalable and secure in-vehicle experiences. Diverse Functionality: SPARQ OS, the platform powering the assistant, offers over 200 apps and features, enriching driver and passenger experiences with navigation, entertainment, and smart controls.

Cybersecurity Leadership:

VicOne’s Max Cheng emphasizes that AI Guardian’s capabilities provide automakers a secure foundation for differentiating their offerings, while P3’s Marius Mailat underscores the collaboration’s role in fostering driver trust through secure innovation.

Speaking Session:

Jay Yaneza, cybersecurity architect at VicOne, will present on January 9 at 11:30 a.m. at the AWS Theater, discussing “GenAI: Transformer of Automotive Product Security Risk Management in SDV Era.” The session will explore how AI-driven solutions address cybersecurity challenges in software-defined vehicles (SDVs), ensuring compliance with global regulations like UN R155.

Explore VicOne’s innovations at CES 2025 (January 7–10) and learn more at vicone.com/ces.

SMK Electronics Unveils Advanced Automotive Components

SMK Electronics Corporation, U.S.A. announced its showcase of cutting-edge electronic components and technologies for automotive manufacturing at CES 2025 (Booth #52345, Venetian Expo, January 7–10, Las Vegas). The 2025 lineup features High-Power Connectors for e-axle applications, In-Cabin Lighting Modules, Smoke Detection Sensors, and a Passive Keyless Entry System (PKE).

Paul Evans, President of SMK Electronics, emphasized the importance of these innovations in helping OEMs differentiate their offerings in a competitive market.

Key Highlights:

High-Power Connectors: Compact, modular, and efficient solutions for e-axle systems, including On-Board Chargers (OBC), Power Drive Units (PDU), and Battery Management Systems (BMS).

Compact, modular, and efficient solutions for e-axle systems, including On-Board Chargers (OBC), Power Drive Units (PDU), and Battery Management Systems (BMS). In-Cabin Monitoring Solutions: In-Cabin Light Engine Modules Smoke Detector Sensors

Passive Keyless Entry System (PKE): Advanced keyless access system integrating BLE, UWB, and NFC technologies for enhanced vehicle security.

SMK’s innovations aim to enable new functionalities and elevate automotive manufacturing standards.

Autel Energy Redefines EV Charging with Intelligent, Scalable Solutions

Autel Energy, a leader in electric vehicle (EV) charging technology, is transforming the EV charging landscape with its comprehensive solutions. Amid a global surge in EV adoption (25% year-over-year growth in Q1 2024), Autel addresses the growing demand for efficient, scalable infrastructure with innovations in DC and AC charging, intelligent cloud services, and PV-ESS-EVSE integration.

Key Highlights:

Full-Scenario Intelligent Charging Network: Series Charger Platform: Modular and scalable design supporting kilowatt to megawatt charging for diverse needs, including fleet, residential, and destination charging. Comprehensive Cloud Platform: AI-driven operations for smart maintenance, seamless payment, and enhanced user satisfaction. PV-ESS-EVSE Integration: AI-powered renewable energy utilization and energy management for sustainable operations.

Innovative Solutions for EV Charging: DC Charging Solutions: High-power chargers (40 kW to 1440 kW) for ultra-fast, cost-effective charging across applications. AC Charging Solutions: Flexible, dynamic-load management for residential and commercial networks. Intelligent Cloud Services: Predictive maintenance, real-time monitoring, and ISO 15118-compliant payment systems for optimal profitability.



Achievements & Growth:

With 77.8% year-on-year growth in 2024, Autel continues to lead through innovation and design excellence, earning accolades like the Red Dot Design Awards. Supported by a global service network and advanced manufacturing facilities in the U.S. and Vietnam, Autel is well-positioned to meet rising market demands.

Vision for the Future:

“At Autel, we are driven by an unwavering mission to empower a cleaner, smarter, and more connected future,” stated Michelle Luo, Chief Revenue Officer. Autel’s efforts at CES 2025 underscore its commitment to advancing sustainable mobility and shaping the future of energy and transportation.

AiDEN Automotive and HAAS Alert Partner to Revolutionize Connected Vehicle Safety

AiDEN Automotive and HAAS Alert have joined forces in a strategic partnership to enhance connected vehicle safety services for passenger and commercial vehicles. Combining AiDEN Automotive’s privacy-first connectivity expertise with HAAS Alert’s innovative Safety Cloud® platform, the collaboration aims to prevent collisions and save lives. By integrating advanced vehicle-to-everything (V2X) technologies, the partnership will enable seamless communication between vehicles, infrastructure, and roadside assets. Drivers will benefit from timely digital alerts in high-risk scenarios, such as emergency responses and work zones, delivered via in-vehicle displays—all while adhering to global privacy standards.

The partnership underscores the shared commitment of both companies to advancing roadway safety and redefining vehicle connectivity. AiDEN Automotive’s dedication to user-controlled, privacy-compliant data aligns with HAAS Alert’s proven track record of connecting millions of drivers to critical safety alerts through its expansive Safety Cloud network. Together, they aim to provide scalable solutions that improve driver awareness, reduce accidents, and foster trust in connected vehicle ecosystems. This collaboration also highlights the growing importance of cross-industry innovation in building safer, smarter, and privacy-focused transportation systems globally.

Aeva and Wideye Unveil Industry-First In-Cabin 4D LiDAR Solution for Passenger Vehicles at CES 2025

Aeva® (NYSE: AEVA), a leader in advanced sensing and perception systems, and Wideye, AGC Group’s optical sensor integration division, have introduced the first functional in-cabin 4D LiDAR solution using Frequency Modulated Continuous Wave (FMCW) technology for passenger vehicles. The collaboration integrates Aeva’s Atlas™ 4D LiDAR sensor with Wideye’s custom-formulated glass to deliver enhanced performance and seamless vehicle design.

The Wideye glass, compatible with Aeva’s FMCW wavelength, offers high infrared transparency and minimal absorption, ensuring high-quality LiDAR performance at full detection range. Positioned behind the windshield, the sensor benefits from protection against external elements, ease of cleaning, and compact housing for passenger comfort. This integration supports advanced vehicle automation and safety without compromising aesthetics or aerodynamics.

The solution will be showcased at CES 2025 in Aeva’s booth #6900, West Hall, Las Vegas Convention Center.

8.title: Tyler Mark Taylor Obituary January 6, 2025
8.snippet: Tyler Mark Taylor of Bedford, Texas, passed away on January 6, 2025, at the age of 78. He was born on October 4, 1946, in Jayton, Texas.
8.content:
Tyler Mark Taylor of Bedford, Texas, passed away on January 6, 2025, at the age of 78. He was born on October 4, 1946, in Jayton, Texas, to Robert and Donna Taylor. Mark grew up with a desire to fly and worked toward making that dream come true. After high school, he earned a Bachelor’s Degree, and while in school, he met Anita McFerrin who he married on April 5, 1969. They were blessed with three children and were married 55 years. After working as a substitute and at Texas Instruments, the two embarked upon the exciting journey of serving in the Army. Mark enlisted in 1973 and rose to the rank of Major before retiring after 20 years of service.

Mark fulfilled his dream of flying by becoming a helicopter pilot in the Army and graduated flight school at the top of his class. He understood the intricacies of the how a helicopter worked and could not only pilot the craft but fix it as well. His aptitude allowed him to fly three different aircraft: the OH-58 Kiowa, Huey, and Chinook.

The Army also provided many opportunities for traveling. Throughout the many duty stations, the Taylor family camped, built an igloo in Alaska, explored Europe, and earned too many medals on Volksmarches in Germany. Mark enjoyed learning history, and driving his family around in minivans on adventures all over the of the world. From black ice in Alaska to lost toll tickets in the Alps, memories were created on every trip.

Mark was a man of many talents. He had a mechanical mind but was also very artistic. He could fix most anything, although it was often with paperclips, super glue, or used coke cans. Mark decorated many cakes for his kids’ birthdays and always came up with designs to match their current interests. He had a love for all pets. He would allow Muffin to climb up on his flight suit, he gave Lizzy CPR when she got into some allergens, and gave Ziggy lots of treats.

Mark is survived by his wife Anita, daughter Trisha Handy and her husband Brian, son Tyler and wife Kazumi, son Todd and his wife Joann, and granddaughters Brianna Handy and Yukino Taylor. He was preceded in death by his father Robert Taylor and uncle Charlie Taylor In lieu of flowers, please donate in Mark’s name to Airport Freeway church of Christ https://tithe.ly/give_new/www/#/tithely/give-one-time/906324

9.title: Stradvision teams with TI, AMD for ADAS system ...
9.snippet: Stradvision in South Korea is using the latest TDA4 silicon from Texas Instruments for a Level 2 domain controller and has signed a deal to run its software on...
9.content:
Stradvision teams with TI, AMD for ADAS system Business news | January 6, 2025 By Nick Flaherty



Stradvision in South Korea is using the latest TDA4 silicon from Texas Instruments for a Level 2 domain controller and has signed a deal to run its software on AMD’s FPGAs.

The Stradvision SVNet 3D Perception Network uses the TI TDA4VPE-Q1 system-on-a-chip (SoC) in a deep learning-powered ADAS and autonomous driving system. The system supports diverse imaging solutions, including Level 2 and Level 2+ ADAS, auto valet parking, 3D surround view, and more making it a versatile and cost-effective choice for next-generation automotive applications.

The TDA4VPE integrates advanced sensor fusion, edge AI, graphics, and video co-processing. With 16 TOPS of AI performance, four ARM Cortex-A72 cores, optimized memory architecture, and a heterogeneous design, it delivers unparalleled efficiency while lowering system costs.

Using the chip, the SVNet 3D Perception Network solution converts 2D camera data into precise 3D environmental maps, enabling vehicles to perceive their surroundings with exceptional clarity. It can also support high-level autonomous driving across various Operational Design Domains (ODD), including complex and challenging conditions.

The system is on show at the CES 2025 show in Las Vegas this week with multi-camera inputs for advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS), such as Level 2+ highway driving, auto valet parking, 3D surround view, and memory-based automatic parking.

The deal with AMD is the first to port the 3D Perception SVNet onto the Versal AI Edge series devices. At CES 2025 the two are showing a joint technology demonstration with an 8MP front-facing camera using the AI inference engines in the FPGA.

“Our work with AMD represents a pivotal moment for Stradvision,” said Philip Vidal, chief business officer of Stradvision. “Combining cutting-edge real-time processing technology from AMD with our SVnet advanced 3D perception network enables us to redefine industry standards for performance, reliability, and scalability in automated driving systems.”

“Stradvision is helping accelerate autonomous vehicles by increasing the access to ADAS technologies by reducing its cost without compromising its capability,” said Wayne Lyons, Senior Director of Marketing, Automotive Segment at AMD.

“We are proud to collaborate with Texas Instruments to bring cost-effective yet powerful solutions to the automotive industry,” said Vidal. “The TDA4VPE-Q1 automotive SoC, paired with the SVNet, exemplifies our shared vision for advancing ADAS technologies. With production-ready software development concluding in 2025 and a Start of Production (SoP) targeted for 2026, we are poised to meet the demands of an evolving market. This collaboration also underscores our commitment to global expansion, enabling us to address the rising demand for innovative and scalable solutions worldwide,” he said.

“The TDA4VPE-Q1 automotive system-on-a-chip for L2 domain controllers with graphics, AI, and video co-processing embodies our vision of delivering high-performance, flexible, and efficient solutions for next-generation automotive applications,” said Mike Pienovi, product line manager at Texas Instruments. “Our collaboration with Stradvision and their SVNet software demonstrates how technology can accelerate the move from 2D to 3D perception networks.”

Stradvision also recently signed a master license agreement with Renesas Electronics to integrate the SVNet software with the R-Car system-on-chip platform as part of the Renesas RoX SDV development platform.

This will work with the R-Car V4H/V4M and coming R-Car Gen 5 series devices such as the X5.

www.ti.com; www.stradvision.com; www.amd.com

0.title: STRADVISION to Showcase Groundbreaking ADAS Innovations at CES 2025 featuring Texas Instruments technology
0.snippet: STRADVISION, a leader in deep learning-based vision perception technology is set to showcase their latest innovations featuring Texas Instruments (TI)...
0.content:
Demonstration of the new TI TDA4VPE-Q1 automotive system-on-chip with STRADVISION's production-ready SVNet 3D perception network for ADAS and autonomous driving

LAS VEGAS, Jan. 5, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- STRADVISION, a leader in deep learning-based vision perception technology is set to showcase their latest innovations featuring Texas Instruments (TI) processors at CES 2025. The collaboration highlights the integration of TI's TDA4VPE-Q1 system-on-a-chip (SoC) for L2 domain controllers and STRADVISION's SVNet 3D Perception Network, a production-ready, deep learning-powered solution that redefines ADAS and autonomous driving capabilities.

A Fusion of Cutting-Edge Technologies: SVNet 3D Perception Network based on the TDA4VPE-Q1 SoC

The TI TDA4VPE-Q1 automotive SoC, designed for multi-camera ADAS applications, integrates advanced sensor fusion, edge AI, graphics, and video co-processing. With 16 TOPS of AI performance, 4x Arm® Cortex®-A72 cores, optimized memory architecture, and a heterogeneous design, it delivers unparalleled efficiency while lowering system costs. This platform supports diverse imaging solutions, including Level 2 and Level 2+ ADAS, auto valet parking, 3D surround view, and more making it a versatile and cost-effective choice for next-generation automotive applications.

Paired with the TI TDA4VPE-Q1 SoC, the SVNet 3D Perception Network solution converts 2D camera data into precise 3D environmental maps, enabling vehicles to perceive their surroundings with exceptional clarity. Designed for adaptability, the SVNet platform supports high-level autonomous driving across various Operational Design Domains (ODD), including complex and challenging conditions.

Showcasing Innovation at CES 2025

At CES 2025, attendees can witness a live demonstration of the SVNet based on TDA4VPE-Q1 automotive SoC. The demo highlights its capabilities in enabling multi-camera inputs for advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS), such as Level 2+ highway driving, auto valet parking, 3D surround view, and memory-based automatic parking.

A Game-Changer for Automotive Applications

STRADVISION's SVNet, integrated with the TDA4V-Mid Plus Eco SoC, empowers automotive OEMs to deliver scalable ADAS solutions. The SoC's flexibility accommodates various image sensors and resolutions, supporting ADAS domain controllers, front cameras, surround views, and mirror replacement. This collaboration paves the way for innovation in automotive, robotics, and security systems.

"We are proud to collaborate with Texas Instruments to bring cost-effective yet powerful solutions to the automotive industry," said Philip Vidal, CBO of STRADVISION. "The TDA4VPE-Q1 automotive SoC, paired with STRADVISION's SVNet, exemplifies our shared vision for advancing ADAS technologies. With production-ready software development concluding in 2025 and a Start of Production (SoP) targeted for 2026, we are poised to meet the demands of an evolving market. This collaboration also underscores our commitment to global expansion, enabling us to address the rising demand for innovative and scalable solutions worldwide."

"The TDA4VPE-Q1 automotive system-on-a-chip for L2 domain controllers with graphics, AI, and video co-processing embodies our vision of delivering high-performance, flexible, and efficient solutions for next-generation automotive applications," said Mike Pienovi, product line manager at Texas Instruments. "Our collaboration with STRADVISION and their SVNet software demonstrates how technology can accelerate the move from 2D to 3D perception networks."

Event Details:

Date: January 7–10, 2025

January 7–10, 2025 Location: Westgate Hotel Hospitality Suite #2951, Las Vegas , Nevada

For more information on STRADVISION and its industry-leading technologies, please visit STRADVISION.

About STRADVISION

Founded in 2014, STRADVISION is an automotive industry pioneer in artificial intelligence-based vision perception technology for ADAS. The company is accelerating the advent of fully autonomous vehicles by making ADAS features available at a fraction of the market cost compared with competitors. STRADVISION's SVNet is being deployed on various vehicle models in partnership with OEMs; can power ADAS and autonomous vehicles worldwide; and is serviced by over 300 employees in Seoul, San Jose, Detroit, Tokyo, Shanghai, and Dusseldorf. STRADVISION has been honored with Frost & Sullivan's 2022 Global Technology Innovation Leadership Award, the Gold Award at the 2022 and 2021 AutoSens Awards for Best-in-Class Software for Perception Systems, and the 2020 Autonomous Vehicle Technology ACES Award in Autonomy (software category). In addition, STRADVISION and its software have achieved TISAX's AL3 standard for information security management, as well as being certified to the ISO 9001:2015 for Quality Management Systems and ISO 26262 for Automotive Functional Safety.

SOURCE StradVision

1.title: @CES025 News Sunday: STRADVISION, Texas Instruments, Renesas, Infineon & Flex
1.snippet: This is an update with new news from CES on Sunday January 5, 2025 with news from STRADVISION, Texas Instruments, Renesas, Infineon & Flex.
1.content:
AUTO Connected Car News published the ultimate guide to Automotive and Autonomous with over 40 announcements and news releases for CES. This is an update with new news from CES on Sunday January 5, 2025 with news from STRADVISION, Texas Instruments, Renesas, Infineon & Flex.

STRADVISION and Texas Instruments Unveil Advanced ADAS Innovations at CES 2025

STRADVISION, a leader in deep learning-based vision technology, will showcase its SVNet 3D Perception Network at CES 2025, highlighting its integration with Texas Instruments’ (TI) TDA4VPE-Q1 automotive system-on-a-chip (SoC). This collaboration redefines ADAS and autonomous driving capabilities by converting 2D camera data into accurate 3D environmental maps, enabling enhanced multi-camera applications like Level 2+ highway driving, auto valet parking, and 3D surround view.

TI’s TDA4VPE-Q1 SoC boasts 16 TOPS of AI performance, advanced sensor fusion, and an efficient architecture, making it ideal for scalable, cost-effective ADAS solutions. The partnership aims to deliver production-ready solutions by 2025, with a Start of Production (SoP) in 2026, revolutionizing automotive and robotics systems worldwide. CES attendees can experience live demonstrations at the Westgate Hotel Hospitality Suite, Las Vegas.

STRADVISION and Renesas Showcase 3D ADAS Innovations at CES 2025

At CES 2025, STRADVISION announced its collaboration with Renesas Electronics Corporation to integrate its SVNet software into Renesas’ R-Car Open Access (RoX) platform. The partnership will showcase a cutting-edge 3D perception system powered by an 8MP Front View Camera (FVC) on the Renesas R-Car V4H platform. This demonstration highlights SVNet’s high efficiency and low computing requirements, offering a scalable solution for Software-Defined Vehicles (SDVs).

Set for production in 2026, this innovation bridges ADAS and IVI functionalities, paving the way for broader adoption of advanced safety and autonomous driving technologies. Attendees can experience this breakthrough at STRADVISION’s CES 2025 booth in Las Vegas, where the company continues to redefine the future of mobility with cost-effective, high-performance solutions.

Infineon and Flex Unveil Modular Zone Controller for Software-Defined Vehicles at CES 2025

Infineon Technologies AG and Flex, a global manufacturer and Infineon’s new preferred automotive design partner, introduced the Flex Modular Zone Controller platform at CES 2025. This scalable, production-ready Zone Control Unit (ZCU) is tailored for software-defined vehicles, offering automakers rapid implementation and adaptability to specific requirements.

The platform features a modular microcontroller (MCU) architecture and Infineon’s advanced chipsets, combined with Flex’s design and manufacturing expertise. It optimizes power distribution, gateway, and motor control solutions, accelerating time-to-market and manufacturing ramp-up.

Infineon’s SVP Hans Adlkofer highlighted the synergy between Infineon’s chipset innovations and Flex’s design speed, enabling automakers to customize ZCUs efficiently. Mike Thoeny, President of Automotive at Flex, emphasized the importance of partnerships to support the shift toward next-generation mobility with software-defined vehicles.

The Flex Modular Zone Controller platform simplifies ZCU development with endpoint-agnostic control, rapid evaluation of key component features, and seamless integration of power distribution and actuation functions.

2.title: Sarah Jane Garrison (Cox)
2.snippet: Sarah Jane Garrison (Cox), also known as “Aunt SaSa” to her family, was born at home in Cunningham, Texas, on June 25, 1940. Sarah went to be with the Lord...
2.content:
Sarah Jane Garrison (Cox), also known as “Aunt SaSa” to her family, was born at home in Cunningham, Texas, on June 25, 1940. Sarah went to be with the Lord on December 4, 2024, at the age of 84. She was a beloved wife and mother preceded in death by her husband James “Jim” McAfee. After graduating from Daingerfield High School in 1958, she attended beauty school, worked at the Ennis Sewing Factory, Texas Instruments and Haggard Slacks. She was a faithful member of Ladies Auxiliary VFW in Garland. After moving to Ennis, she became a member of Calvary Baptist Church. Sarah wore many hats, a jack of all trades, with never a dull moment. Throughout her life, she held an unwavering faith in God, which she shared with those who surrounded her. She held a strong conviction in Jesus and was a steadfast follower.

Sarah was preceded in death by her loving parents, Fred T. and Robbie M. Cox, and her siblings: Raeul G. Cox, Sr., Fred Lavon Cox, Loy G. Cox, Judy Teal and Nancy Reese.

She is survived by her son, Richard Dobecka and wife, Liz; daughter, LaVonna Vasquez and husband, Mario, Sr.; grandchildren: Mario Vasquez, Jr. and wife, Kacey; Maegen McKee and husband, Bryce; Leigh Rountree and husband, Josh; Garrett Seaman and wife, Trang; great grandchildren: Slevin Vasquez, Rowan, Elias, Leon and Jimena McKee, Gage and Everleigh Rountree, Kayli and Summer Nguyen, Cruz and Enzo Seaman.

Celebration of life will be held at Calvary Baptist Church, 805 W. Baldridge St., Ennis, Texas, on January 11, 2025, at 11 a.m. Arrangements entrusted to J.E. Keever Mortuary, Inc., in Ennis, Texas.

6.title: STRADVISION Brings Production-Ready AI Vision to CES® 2025
6.snippet: PRNewswire/ -- STRADVISION, a global leader in AI-based vision perception technology, will showcase its latest innovation at CES® 2025 in Las Vegas. The...
6.content:
Experience the full interactive Multichannel News Release here: https://www.multivu.com/stradvision/9311851-en-stradvision-brings-production-ready-ai-vision-ces-2025

Revolutionizing Autonomous Driving Technology

The SVNet 3D Perception Network marks a transformative leap in vision perception for advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS) and autonomous driving (AD). This cutting-edge deep learning solution converts 2D camera data into highly precise 3D environmental maps, enabling vehicles to "see" their surroundings with unparalleled accuracy.

Since its initial debut, the technology has achieved remarkable advancements:

Enhanced Maturity and Vision: The inclusion of SurroundVision supports high-level autonomous driving (Level 2+ and beyond), operating across a broader range of Operational Design Domains (ODD). This includes diverse weather conditions, challenging climates, and complex environments, paving the way for greater environmental adaptability.

The inclusion of SurroundVision supports high-level autonomous driving (Level 2+ and beyond), operating across a broader range of Operational Design Domains (ODD). This includes diverse weather conditions, challenging climates, and complex environments, paving the way for greater environmental adaptability. New Parking Capabilities: A major milestone, the SVNet 3D Perception Network now introduces autonomous parking capabilities, signaling a significant step toward full vehicle autonomy.

A major milestone, the SVNet 3D Perception Network now introduces autonomous parking capabilities, signaling a significant step toward full vehicle autonomy. Mass Production Readiness: Production-ready software development will conclude in 2025, with the Start of Production (SoP) targeted for 2026.

Production-ready software development will conclude in 2025, with the Start of Production (SoP) targeted for 2026. Global Expansion: STRADVISION is extending manufacturing into new regions, reinforcing its commitment to addressing global demand and expanding its market reach.

These advancements position the SVNet 3D Perception Network as a foundational technology for next-generation ADAS/AD-equipped vehicles, offering unmatched scalability and functionality.

Pioneering Milestones and Global Impact

STRADVISION is on track to complete production-ready software by the end of 2025, marking the culmination of its mass production development journey. The Start of Production (SoP) is planned for 2026, accompanied by strategic expansion into new manufacturing regions to support its ambitious global market strategy.

Exclusive Live Demonstration at CES 2025

Visitors at CES 2025 will have the opportunity to witness the capabilities of the SVNet 3D Perception Network through a live demonstration based on the various SoC platforms. This showcase will highlight the network's MultiVision capabilities, including its new parking functionality, demonstrating its readiness for real-world deployment.

"Transforming the SVNet 3D Perception Network from a prototype to production-ready software within a year underscores STRADVISION's unwavering commitment to innovation and excellence," said Junhwan Kim, CEO of STRADVISION. "CES 2025 provides an exciting platform to demonstrate how this groundbreaking technology is redefining adaptability and functionality in the global automotive industry."

For more information on STRADVISION and its industry-leading technologies, please visit STRADVISION.

SOURCE STRADVISION

0.title: Obituary | Agostinho R. Campos of Taunton, Massachusetts
0.snippet: Agostinho R. Campos, age 88, of Taunton, passed away peacefully on Saturday, January 4, 2025, at Morton Hospital, surrounded by his loving family.
0.content:
Agostinho R. Campos, age 88, of Taunton, passed away peacefully on Saturday, January 4, 2025, at Morton Hospital, surrounded by his loving family. He was the cherished husband of Almerinda A. (Serodio) Campos, with whom he would have celebrated 71 years of marriage this coming March.

He was born on São Miguel Island in the Azores; son of the late Bento R. Campos and Angelina Resendes. He immigrated to the United States on November 4, 1966, where he built a life rooted in hard work and devotion to his family. Agostinho worked as a laborer at Texas Instruments for over 30 years before retiring.

Agostinho was a man who found joy in staying active and embracing life’s simple pleasures. He loved working on his home and yard, raising chickens and rabbits, and spending time outdoors. Camping trips and evenings by the fire brought him great happiness. An annual tradition of making wine reflected his resourcefulness and zest for life. Known for his great sense of humor, Agostinho brought laughter and warmth to those around him.

Family gatherings were especially meaningful to him, filled with music, laughter, and treasured moments shared with friends and loved ones. These occasions created lasting memories that will be cherished by all who knew him.

In addition to his wife, Agostinho is survived by his children, Vasco Campos and his wife Tracey, Francis Campos, Luiza Campos, and Nelia Campos and her husband Scott Streeseman; his grandchildren, Christine Ballentine, Joshua Campos, Chris Campos, Darlene Campos, Eric Campos, Maisie Streeseman, Jacob Streeseman, and Elsie Streeseman; as well as his great-grandchildren, Abbigail Ballentine and Allison Ballentine. Annabel Ballentine and Benjamin Campos along with many nieces, nephews and extended family.

Predeceased by his parents and his siblings, Onorina, Olinda, Manuel and Jose

Agostinho’s legacy of love and laughter will live on in the hearts of his family and friends.

TENTATIVE A time of Visitation will be held on Sunday, January 12, 2025 from 2pm - 5pm in the Crapo-Hathaway Funeral Home, 350 Somerset Ave., Taunton. A Mass of Christian Burial will be celebrated on Monday, January 13, 2025 at 10:00am in St. Anthony Church, 126 School Street, Taunton. Followed by a burial in St. Joseph's Cemetery, Taunton.

To plant Memorial Trees in memory of Agostinho R. Campos, please click here to visit our Sympathy Store.

2.title: Raymond Tremblay
2.snippet: Raymond L. Tremblay, 86, of The Villages, FL, passed away on December 27, 2024. Raymond was born June 17, 1938, in Pawtucket, RI.
2.content:
Raymond Tremblay

The Villages – Raymond L. Tremblay, 86, of The Villages, FL, passed away on December 27, 2024. Raymond was born June 17, 1938, in Pawtucket, RI, the son of Alcide and Gertrude.

Raymond spent most of his life in Pawtucket, and graduated from St. Raphael Academy in 1956. He served in the Army Reserves from 1959 until 1965. Raymond married Lucille Blais, also of Pawtucket, in 1962 at St. Cecilia Church.

Together they had five children during their 62 years of marriage. Raymond worked as Facility Manager at Texas Instruments in Attleboro, MA, for 38 years. Raymond especially loved to travel, spending vacations together with Lucille driving throughout the country visiting many national parks and 48 of the states.

Preceding Raymond in death is his son James. Remaining to cherish Raymond’s memory are his wife Lucille; daughter Anne Marie of Rhode Island and Florida; son John of Rhode Island, his wife Wendy, grandson Stephen, granddaughters Ashley, Stephanie and Toni, and greatgrandchildren Trevor, Nolan and Newt; son Thomas of Pennsylvania; son David of Massachusetts, his wife Coreen and granddaughter Sophia.

Funeral services will be held at St. Mark’s Catholic Church, Summerfield, FL, on Thursday, January 9, at 10 a.m., followed by burial at Lone Oak Cemetery in Leesburg FL.

3.title: Capital International Investors Expands Stake in FTAI Aviation L
3.snippet: On December 31, 2024, Capital International Investors (Trades, Portfolio) executed a significant transaction involving FTAI Aviation Ltd. The firm added...
3.content:
On December 31, 2024, Capital International Investors (Trades, Portfolio) executed a significant transaction involving FTAI Aviation Ltd. The firm added 3,205,596 shares of FTAI Aviation Ltd to its portfolio, marking a 41.95% increase in its position. This strategic move underscores the firm's confidence in the potential of FTAI Aviation Ltd, a company specializing in commercial jet engines and aviation leasing. The transaction was executed at a price of $144.04 per share, bringing the total holding to 10,847,929 shares. This addition represents 0.3% of Capital International Investors (Trades, Portfolio)' portfolio and 10.60% of the firm's holdings in FTAI Aviation Ltd.

Capital International Investors (Trades, Portfolio) is a subsidiary of the Capital Research and Management Company, which is part of The Capital Group Companies. The firm is one of three equity divisions managing assets for the parent company, alongside Capital World Investors and Capital Research Global Investors. Known for its bottom-up investment approach, Capital International Investors (Trades, Portfolio) focuses on rigorous fundamental research to identify attractive investments and manage risks. The firm manages an estimated market value of approximately $55 trillion, with significant investments in companies like Verizon Communications, Microsoft, and Texas Instruments. Its investment strategy is heavily weighted towards the technology and financial services sectors.

FTAI Aviation Ltd: Company Overview

FTAI Aviation Ltd, based in the USA, is an aerospace company that owns and maintains commercial jet engines, focusing on CFM56 engines. The company also engages in aviation leasing, investing in aviation assets and aerospace products that generate stable cash flows and potential earnings growth. With a market capitalization of $15.52 billion, FTAI Aviation Ltd is considered significantly overvalued according to GuruFocus valuation metrics. The stock's current price is $151.38, with a price-to-GF value ratio of 2.14, indicating a substantial overvaluation.

Financial Metrics and Valuation

FTAI Aviation Ltd has a GF Score of 73/100, suggesting likely average performance. The company has demonstrated impressive growth, with a 49.90% revenue growth over the past three years and a 24.70% EBITDA growth in the same period. Despite a strong Growth Rank of 10/10, the stock's Profitability and Balance Sheet ranks are moderate at 7/10 and 4/10, respectively. The company's Operating Margin growth is notable at 21.70%, although its Piotroski F-Score is relatively low at 3, indicating potential financial challenges.

Other Notable Investors in FTAI Aviation Ltd

Besides Capital International Investors (Trades, Portfolio), other prominent investors in FTAI Aviation Ltd include Mario Gabelli (Trades, Portfolio), Jefferies Group (Trades, Portfolio), and Keeley-Teton Advisors, LLC (Trades, Portfolio). First Eagle Investment (Trades, Portfolio) Management, LLC holds the largest share percentage of the stock among gurus, highlighting the interest of major investors in the company's potential.

Transaction Analysis

The recent acquisition by Capital International Investors (Trades, Portfolio) reflects a strategic decision to bolster its stake in FTAI Aviation Ltd, despite the stock's significant overvaluation. This move could be seen as a long-term investment strategy, banking on the company's growth potential and stable cash flow generation. The transaction's impact on the firm's portfolio is relatively modest, representing 0.3% of its total holdings. However, it significantly increases the firm's exposure to FTAI Aviation Ltd, now accounting for 10.60% of its holdings in the company. This decision aligns with Capital International Investors (Trades, Portfolio)' investment philosophy of leveraging rigorous research to identify promising opportunities.

0.title: Here’s Why Texas Instruments Incorporated (TXN) Is Among The Stocks Targeted By Activist Hedge Funds
0.snippet: In this article, we are going to take a look at where Texas Instruments Incorporated (NASDAQ:TXN) stands against the other stocks targeted by activist hedge...
0.content:
We recently compiled a list of the 15 Stocks Targeted By Activist Hedge Funds. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Texas Instruments Incorporated (NASDAQ:TXN) stands against the other stocks targeted by activist hedge funds.

Shareholder activism continued at a record pace in 2024 as activist hedge funds pushed for strategic changes in various companies to unlock hidden value. In the first nine months of the year, 184 activist hedge fund campaigns were up and running, 26% above the four-year average. The surge came as new activists joined the fray and spearheaded 22% of the campaigns.

Why Was Shareholder Activism on The Rise?

A number of factors can be emphasized. One is the global economy cooling down. Although the US economy appeared to be on track to a soft landing, as many experts had predicted, economic growth remained timid, and other nations like Germany were on the verge of going into recession.

The rise of so-called ESG investing is another factor contributing to increased shareholder activism. Environmental, social, and governance, or ESG, is a relatively recent trend in which investors purchase stock in a company for its intrinsic value and because it performs well on ESG metrics. Some activist investors have positioned themselves as ESG-focused in the midst of this trend.

READ ALSO: 10 Best Penny Stocks to Buy for 2025 and 10 Best Stocks to Buy According to Billionaire D.E. Shaw.

Nevertheless, only 30% of the top ten activist investors accounted for the total campaigns in 2024, down from 46% in the same period in 2023. On the other hand, most of the campaigns were less successful in breaking into company boardrooms as management fought back.

Management pushed back on several campaigns even as activist hedge funds were forced to settle on management changes. Additionally, as investors’ newfound freedom to choose between management and dissident slates makes it easier to get representation on boards, the universal proxy card continues to lead to more settlements between activists and businesses.

Even though winning board seats isn’t the main goal of every campaign, the quantity of victories indicates how well businesses are defending themselves. Dissidents won 74 seats in the first half, compared to 93 in the same period in 2023. Activists only secured 11% of the seats they were vying for in US proxy elections, compared to 65% in 2023.

Similarly, a push for company sales by activist hedge funds hit a snag as buyouts throughout the year were scarce owing to the high interest rate environment. High interest rates made it difficult for companies to access cheap capital that they could use to complete acquisitions.

According to Jim Rossman, head of the Barclays advisory group, there hasn’t been much merger and acquisition activity in the past two years. The activists’ preferred method of obtaining value from a company’s stock is weakened as a result. The most frequent demand of activists is still M&A, but they are now more focused on altering a company’s board and management.

“Activism has become increasingly sophisticated as a tactic,” says Rossman, who sees firms hiring bankers, lawyers and private equity veterans. “There’s a greater depth of understanding on how to unlock value in companies.”

As corporate board nominations open in the new year, the pace of activism is expected to increase in the upcoming months. According to Rossman, activist demands for M&A may resurface in 2025 as private equity firms look to use their growing cash and their current holdings.

Activist hedge funds typically have minority, long interests in underperforming businesses that have significant potential for value development. Since value investors make up the majority of activist investors, they must first find undervalued companies.

Our Methodology

To make our list of stocks targeted by activist hedge funds, we looked for companies that made the headlines in the context of renowned activist investors taking a position. We then ranked these companies based on their latest market capitalization.

At Insider Monkey, we are obsessed with the stocks that hedge funds pile into. The reason is simple: our research has shown that we can outperform the market by imitating the top stock picks of the best hedge funds. Our quarterly newsletter’s strategy selects 14 small-cap and large-cap stocks every quarter and has returned 275% since May 2014, beating its benchmark by 150 percentage points (see more details here).

Texas Instruments Incorporated (NASDAQ:TXN)

Company Market Cap as of December 31: $171.1 Billion

Number of Hedge Fund Holders: 57

Texas Instruments Incorporated (NASDAQ:TXN) is a technology company that designs, manufactures, and sells semiconductors to electronics designers and manufacturers. It offers power products to manage power requirements across various voltage levels. The stock was up by 10% in 2024, rallying to record highs as investors reacted to the company’s strategic positioning amid growing demand for chip technology.

Activist hedge fund Elliott Investment Management took a $2.5 billion position in the chip technology company. With the positioning, the hedge fund started agitating for the company to consider adopting a dynamic capacity management strategy. It also urged management to focus on achieving a free cash flow per share target of $9 a share by 2026.

Elliott claims that Texas Instruments Incorporated (NASDAQ:TXN) free cash flow has decreased by over 75% since the company began a significant capacity ramp-up in 2022 and that shareholders have received little information about when free cash flow per share will return to its historical average.

According to the activist investor, the company has expanded its capacity beyond the anticipated demand. Consequently, it is calling for the company to adopt a dynamic capacity management strategy to bolster per-share free cash flow.

Despite a poorer performance in Europe, Texas Instruments Incorporated’s (NASDAQ:TXN) automotive revenues have grown significantly, with strength in China making the difference. The company’s auto revenue growth from quarter to quarter was higher than anticipated. Furthermore, TXN has observed a broader cyclical recovery, with notable expansion in the fields of communications equipment, enterprise systems, and personal electronics, all of which are still below their prior peak levels.

The Diamond Hill Select Strategy likes Texas Instruments Incorporated (NASDAQ:TXN)’s long-term outlook, as revealed in its Q2 2024 investor letter:

“Among our top individual contributors in Q2 were Amazon, Texas Instruments Incorporated (NASDAQ:TXN) and Mr. Cooper Group. Shares of semiconductor manufacturing company Texas Instruments rose in Q2 as demand in several of the company’s end markets show signs of recovering. Given the company’s long-term prospects, competitive positioning and scale advantages, we believe the outlook for the company from here is strong.”

Overall TXN ranks 1st on our list of the stocks targeted by activist hedge funds. While we acknowledge the potential of TXN as an investment, our conviction lies in the belief that certain AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns and doing so within a shorter timeframe. If you are looking for an AI stock that is more promising than TXN but that trades at less than 5 times its earnings check out our report about the cheapest AI stock.
